ðŸ”¥ coinvert | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Currency conversion with real-time rates and a focus on user privacy.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time exchange rate updates â€¢ Support for 200+ global currencies and cryptocurrencies â€¢ Offline mode with cached rates â€¢ Privacy-focused: no ads, no tracking â€¢ Modern, intuitive UI
ðŸ“– Summary: CoinVert is a currency converter that supports over 200 currencies, including cryptocurrencies, providing real-time exchange rate updates. It emphasizes user privacy by avoiding ads, tracking, and data collection, while also offering offline functionality with cached rates. The application aims to provide a modern and intuitive user interface for seamless currency conversions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ OSX-PROXMOX | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Installing and running macOS as a virtual machine on Proxmox VE for development, testing, and educational purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ macOS installation on Proxmox VE â€¢ Supports AMD and Intel hardware â€¢ Supports multiple macOS versions (High Sierra to Sequoia) â€¢ Supports Proxmox VE versions 7.x to 8.4.x
ðŸ“– Summary: The OSX-PROXMOX repository provides a streamlined method for installing macOS on Proxmox VE, supporting both AMD and Intel hardware. It simplifies the virtualization process, enabling users to run various macOS versions from High Sierra to Sequoia on Proxmox. The repository also offers cloud support and integrates OpenCore for enhanced compatibility and security.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ oci2git | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Layer diffing and origin tracking within container images using Git's capabilities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Analyze Docker images and extract layer information â€¢ Create a Git repository where each image layer is represented as a commit â€¢ Support for empty layers as empty commits â€¢ Complete metadata extraction to Markdown format â€¢ Extensible architecture for supporting different container engines
ðŸ“– Summary: OCI2Git converts container images into Git repositories, representing each layer as a commit. This enables users to leverage Git's powerful features like diffing and blame to analyze image layers, track file origins, and understand the evolution of files within the container.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ community | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Knowledge management and documentation
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Open source knowledge management solution â€¢ Self-hosted â€¢ Enterprise-grade â€¢ Built for technical and non-technical users â€¢ Unifies customer-facing and internal documentation
ðŸ“– Summary: Documize Community is an open-source, self-hosted knowledge management solution designed for both technical and non-technical users. It aims to unify customer-facing and internal documentation, offering organization through labels, spaces, and categories. It supports multiple databases and authentication methods, along with multi-language support.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ Sentry | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: macOS security monitoring to detect unauthorized access attempts and record video evidence.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Comprehensive Monitoring (lid status, network connectivity, power connection) â€¢ Automatic Recording (video clips) â€¢ Multi-Alert System (sound alarms, push notifications via Bark) â€¢ Real-time Detection (instant monitoring of device state changes)
ðŸ“– Summary: Sentry is a macOS application designed to monitor your device for unauthorized access. It tracks lid status, network connectivity, and power connection, automatically recording video and providing alerts via sound and push notifications when suspicious activity is detected. This allows users to protect their devices and gather evidence in case of unauthorized access.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ langflow | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building and deploying AI-powered agents and workflows.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Visual Builder for rapid iteration â€¢ Code access for Python customization â€¢ Playground for step-by-step flow testing â€¢ Multi-agent orchestration â€¢ API deployment or JSON export
ðŸ“– Summary: Langflow is a tool for visually building and deploying AI agents and workflows. It offers a visual interface, code access for customization, and the ability to deploy agents as API endpoints. Langflow supports major LLMs and vector databases, providing a comprehensive platform for AI development.
